name: 戴楠青
objective: Technologically, this course introduces the related digital technologies of High Dynamic Range Imaging. Including High Dynamic Range Photography, Physically Based Rendering, Tone mapping, and Image Based Lighting. Intellectually, this course aims to explore the possibilities of utilizing the related technologies of High Dynamic Range Imaging on design and research applications.
schedule:
Week01 HDR & Faithful Picture
Week02 HDR Photography
Week03 HDR Photography in Design & Research
Week04 Tone Mapping
Week05 Current Research on Tone Mapping
Week06 Physically Based Rendering I
Week07 Physically Based Rendering II
Week08 Midterm Discussion
Week09 Physically Based Rendering III
Week10 Image Based Lighting
Week11 Material Measuring
Week12 Electrical Lighting
Week13 Individual Project Discussion I
Week14 Individual Project Discussion II
Week15 Individual Project Discussion III
Week16 Individual Project Discussion IV
Week17 Project Discussion
Week18 Final Review
materials: Reinhard, E., Heidrich, W., Debevec, P., Pattanaik, S., Ward, G., & Myszkowski, K. (2010). High Dynamic Range Imaging, Second Edition: Acquisition, Display, and Image-Based Lighting (2nd ed.). Morgan Kaufman
